review: I've gotta read more on this, but so far this thing sucks! Streaming video is choppy and takes me back to the early days of dial-up. Okay, maybe not that bad. But what displays on the tv is behind what is displaying on my laptop two feet away that is "casting" to the tube. It could be on my end tho. I am using a wireless network so I know that won't be as fast. And I haven't read up on if I need to tweak any settings to make it work better or anything. But as of now, I don't use it and don't even have the desire to mess with it.It just sorta sticks outta the side of my television like some sorta malignant electronic iGrowth.

review: Besides streaming from your handheld device onto the screen, I also thought it would stream from Amazon Prime Video and Netflix directly from the Chromecast device.  It does not unless I have it already running on my handheld device to upload onto the TV.

review: What exactly is this device supposed to do? I was under the impression it would replace my HDMI cable and allow my phone, tablet, and laptop communicate with my tv. But it won't even communicate with itself. That is to say, setup is impossible. It just sits there, saying it's connected to my wireless but can't reach the internet. Despite following every step of the sketchy instructions it just won't work. Going back to Amazon. Big fail google.
